simplenlg.realiser
Class VerbGroupSpec

java.lang.Object
  simplenlg.realiser.Spec
      simplenlg.realiser.PhraseSpec
          simplenlg.realiser.SyntaxPhraseSpec
              simplenlg.realiser.VerbGroupSpec
Direct Known Subclasses:
CoordinateVerbGroupSpec
public class VerbGroupSpec
extends SyntaxPhraseSpec

This is the class that encapsulates a Verb Group (the part of the verb phrase containing a verb, and possibly an auxiliary verb phrase). A VerbGroupSpec consista of the following components:

  • A head verb (possibly with a particle).
  • A list of temporal and aspectual simplenlg.features determining whether the VP is:
    • perfect
    • present, past or future
    • progressive
    • passive
    • negated
  • A Person feature
  • A Number feature
  • A Mood feature
  • A Form feature

Although getter and setter methods are provided, none of these needs to be set explicitly if the VerbGroupSpec is embedded within a sentence (an SPhraseSpec), where setting any of the above simplenlg.features will result in the verb phrase inheriting them.

Author:
agatt

Constructor Detail

VerbGroupSpec

public VerbGroupSpec()
Constructs a new instance of VerbGroupSpec. By default the phrase has all the simplenlg.features perfect, progressive, passive, negated set to false and its tense set to present.

VerbGroupSpec

public VerbGroupSpec(Verb v)
Constructs a new instance of a VerbGroupSpec with a head verb. This is an instance of Verb

Parameters:
v - The Verb

VerbGroupSpec

public VerbGroupSpec(String verb)
Constructs a new instance of a VerbGroupSpec with a head verb string. The constructor automatically renders the string as an instance of a Verb. The String may consist of head + one or more particles. Thus "get up" and "get" are both legal arguments to this constructor.

Parameters:
verb -

setParticle

public void setParticle(AnchorString particle)
For use in case the head verb is phrasal. (e.g. "get up"). The method adds the particle to the main verb of this phrase.

Parameters:
particle - The particle
See Also:
VerbGroupSpec#setParticle(String)

hasSameFeatures

public boolean hasSameFeatures(VerbGroupSpec vp)
Compare two VerbGroupSpecs on the basis of grammatical simplenlg.features.

Parameters:
vp - The VerbGroupSpec that will be compared to this one.
Returns:
true if the two VerbGroupSpecs have identical tense/aspect simplenlg.features (passive, perfect, negated, progressive) and identical grammatical/agreement simplenlg.features (person and number).

suppressAuxiliary

public void suppressAuxiliary(boolean aux)
Suppress the auxiliary phrase during realisation. This means that only the head verb is realised. This is mostly used in conjunction with CoordinateVerbGroupSpec.

Parameters:
aux - If true, the auxiliary is not realised.

coordinate

public CoordinateVerbGroupSpec coordinate(VerbGroupSpec vp)
VCoordinate this VerbGroupSpec to another one to form a CoordinateVerbGroupSpec. The new coordinate verb group will have the same features (tense, passive, etc.) of this VerbGroupSpec.

Parameters:
vp - The VerbGroupSpec
Returns:
a CoordinateVerbGroupSpec
